lines.text: Hey, is this {{name}}?
Awesome — this is Robert with Brad Lea’s team. How’s your day going?
Perfect. Just to let you know, this call is being recorded for training and compliance purposes. Is that ok?
I’ll keep this super simple. This call goes one of three ways, and I’ll tell you upfront so there's no surprises.
One — you’re a fit, and we move you to an interview with our placement team.
Two — not a fit for a sales role right now, and that’s totally fine.
Three — you’re not ready *yet*, but with the right training, you could absolutely crush sales.
Fair enough?
Cool — first question: What’s got you interested in sales opportunities right now?
Got it. What’s your background? What have you been doing up to this point?
And what are you earning right now, roughly?
Ideally, what would you *like* to be earning?
What hours are you available to work?
What kind of environment do you thrive in — structure or freedom?
Let me shoot you straight for a second.
You seem sharp — you listen well, you communicate clearly, and there’s something there.

But I'm a little hesitant putting you straight into one of the sales positions because leads are pretty expensive these days and Brad will kill me if I put someone in that can't convert them right off the bat.
We're going to need you to hit the ball out of the park on day one.
The good news is, I think if Brad trained you, you'd absolutely crush it. Are you willing to be trained in order to get the gig?
Here’s what Brad built — it’s called Real Training.
Mindset to get your head right, Skillset so you can actually close, and Habits so you stay consistent.
It’s fast, structured, and built for people who want real results, not YouTube theory.
To move forward, there’s a fully-refundable deposit to show you’re serious.
It’s $5,000 — and again — it is **FULLY REFUNDABLE**, assuming you don’t quit.
If you complete your training and show up for the role, you get it right back.
Based on everything we covered, does moving forward to placement make sense to you?
If so, I’ll send you the enrollment link now and walk you through it.
